page.title: 01 AREA WEST OF STORTFORD
page.content: There are striking contrasts in landscape in this area of gentle relief with prosperous arable & mixed farms, hedgerows,deciduous woodland & narrow country lanes.There are scattered farms & one nucleated settlement,the hamlet of Bury Green,now occupied by commuters.This rural area is being encroached on by a new residential zone ,Thorley,which has become a suburb of Bishop's Stortford.About 3,000 houses are being built by several well-known companies. There is a shopping area with a free car park dominated by Sainsbury's.A lack of amenities on the estate creates difficulties for young mothers & school children.Further spread of housing seems imminent since the proposed expansion of Stansted airport 4 miles to the east.
